segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious the woman is to the water overflowing right in front of her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying that plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, and it’s creating a puddle around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, reaching for the cookie jar, and it looks like he’s about to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, completely ignoring the mess on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why the drain isn’t working and why the water isn’t going down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so serene, like a completely different world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at them to wake up and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s apron is so neat, but the kitchen is becoming a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just bizarre and a little frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR
